hero.heading: Revenue tracking
hero.subheading: Attach a dollar value to any action - purchase, upgrade, renewal - and see exactly how money flows through your product. No spreadsheets, no stitching.

definition.title: What is event-based revenue tracking?
definition.text:
Most teams track revenue in spreadsheets or payment dashboards that live completely separate from product analytics. You know *how much* you made, but not *why*.

Event-based revenue tracking flips this. Every revenue moment-a purchase, a plan upgrade, a subscription renewal-is captured as a **structured event** with a dollar amount, a user, and a session. That means you can answer questions like:

- **Which signup source drives the most revenue?**
- **How long after onboarding do users make their first purchase?**
- **What features do high-LTV customers use that churning ones don't?**

With OpenPanel, you send a revenue event the same way you send any other event-just include an amount property. From there, revenue flows into **funnels**, **retention charts**, and **user profiles** alongside every other action.

No CSV exports. No stitching Stripe data to analytics data in a spreadsheet. Revenue becomes a first-class dimension of your product analytics, queryable and filterable like everything else.

Because OpenPanel is **privacy-first**, revenue data stays in your infrastructure (self-hosted) or in our cloud with no third-party sharing. You get the insights without the data-privacy trade-offs.

faqs.title: Frequently asked questions
faqs.intro: Common questions about tracking revenue with OpenPanel.

items.question: How do I send a revenue event?
items.answer: Send a regular event (e.g. 'purchase_completed') with a numeric property for the amount. You can include additional properties like currency, plan, or item name. The same SDK or API you use for any other event works for revenue.

items.question: Can I track recurring subscription revenue?
items.answer: Yes. Fire a revenue event on each renewal or billing cycle. Over time you can chart MRR trends, retention by cohort, and expansion revenue-all from events.

items.question: Do I need to integrate my payment provider?
items.answer: No direct integration is needed. You send revenue events from your backend whenever a payment is confirmed (e.g. in a Stripe webhook handler). OpenPanel doesn't talk to Stripe-it just receives the event you send.

items.question: Can I track refunds?
items.answer: Yes. Send a refund event with a negative amount or a separate event name (e.g. 'refund_issued'). You can then subtract refunds from gross revenue in your dashboards.

items.question: Is revenue data shared with third parties?
items.answer: No. OpenPanel is privacy-first. Self-host to keep revenue data entirely in your infrastructure, or use our cloud where data is never shared with third parties.
